  • 'ENAS is creating more opportunities, wider networks and bigger conversations for artists and studios' - Sue Willis, HoFS
  • ENAS increases artistic excellence by encouraging creative dialogue between studios through collaborative programmes.
  • ENAS focuses on raising studio profiles, promoting business resilience, and offering professional development opportunities.

Featured Studios

Cuckoo Farm Studios
Cuckoo Farm Studios is an artist run organisation formed in 1992, in converted farm buildings on the northern outskirts of the historical town of Colchester. Since then it has grown to become a valuable resource within the wider community...
Slack Space
Slack Space Colchester is a not-for-profit volunteer run initiative that successfully transforms empty shops and buildings into community art spaces, where local artists can work, present new & exciting art to the general public as...
High House
Purpose-designed three-storey studio building comprising 39 self-contained studios and four work/live units. Ground floor contains seven large multi-purpose spaces for large-scale making, with the two upper floors containing 32 studio...
liz boast
Featured Artist

liz boast

Figurative prints.  From small hand-coloured drypoints to large woodcuts, monotypes to collagraphs, Liz Boast's prints have a certain darkness in their heart, leaving the viewer to wonder what sort of character could dream it up.

ENAS launches at firstsite, 27 March 2014
Jane Morrow
ENAS and firstsite were excited to welcome hundreds of artists from across the county on Thursday 27 March. The event was structured in two parts: firstly, the afternoon event focused on artists, studios and...
